person.persName: Cornelius Pering (Louisville, Kentucky, founder Louisville Female Institute)

body.p: Louisville, Kentucky, teacher and principal. Native of England. Married to Susan Hine Pering in Dorset, England, on August 24, 1828. Father of Cornelius H. Pering, Alfred Pering, Zenobia Pering, James G. Pering, Cornelia Pering and William H. Pering. Married to Charlotte Carmichael Pering in Jefferson County, Kentucky, on August 8, 1846. Attended the Royal Academy of London in London, England. Immigrated to the United States on August 26, 1832. Received an honorary Masters of Arts from Indiana University in Bloomington, Indiana, in 1837. Principal of the Monroe County Female Institute in Monroe County, Indiana, from 1835 to 1846. Founded the Louisville Female Institute in Louisville, Kentucky, in 1847. Principal of the Louisville Female Institute from 1847 through 1865. Owned one enslaved person in Louisville in 1850. Hired one enslaved person in Louisville in 1860.
